TopicTitle: [WIP] Cacteye Telescope v0.1 (2/1/14) - Modular, EVA-serviceable orbital telescope

Articles.Content:
Well, I don't even know what HullCamera is and still the game is freezing on loading tele_processor_high...

Confirm, after updating HullCamVDS to ver 0.3 this mod makes KSP stuck at load time. All three processor parts are actually involved (high, mid, low). Tweaked a bit with various files, it shows the issue is related to the module "name= TelescopeProcessor" with each config file: removing just that module from the config files, KSP loads.

I would suspect there is now a similarly named module with HullCamVDS, and that is creating incompatibility (the values within the config don't match with the HullCam module), but have to further investigate this. If it is a confirmed issue coming from HullCam, I am going to post over that thread to mention this inconvenience.

Diomedea just brought the issue to my attention. As far as I can tell(from my phone) is that it's a cateye plugin problem.

I'll see if theres is something that can be done to fix this as soon as I have time.

Edited June 8, 2014 by Albert VDS

So I recompiled CatEyeTelescope.dll with the newest version of Hullcam VDS.

Here's a link: http://www./download/iuiq2cwx0sh3124/CactEyeTelescope.dll

Don't have time to test it, only saw that the game could go all the way to the VAB.

Please let me know if this fixes the problems.

So I recompiled CatEyeTelescope.dll with the newest version of Hullcam VDS.

Here's a link: http://www./download/iuiq2cwx0sh3124/CactEyeTelescope.dll

Don't have time to test it, only saw that the game could go all the way to the VAB.

Please let me know if this fixes the problems.

Sure now KSP loads with that recompiled dll. And, tried with a Cacteye telescope already in orbit, it works.

Albert VDS, many thanks .

Edited June 10, 2014 by Javster
I really hope there's a fix because this mod looks great

The link to the screen capture fails as not being publicly viewable. Makes it hard to see what's wrong

Have never had a problem even close to what you're having, so has to be some sort of install or conflict problem. It is a great mod, I use it in every career

Also, double check to make sure you have all the required updates. I'm sure you already have, but never want to assume when there is a problem.

Sorry about that! I'll unlock it somehow EDIT: here's the link http://imgur.com/a/Jawsv

You certainly do have it in the right place. Have you tried it without ScienceRedefined being installed? It is one of the ones I don't use (yes, after checking into it from this I'm likely to try it myself ) and have seen others with science mod issues with relation to this. Not the same symptoms but have to start somewhere. With luck Rubber Ducky or another with more knowledge of the internal functions of this can chime in to help identify where the conflict is so this can get up and running for you.

@ Javster: if I read correctly your list of mods, you don't have HullCamVDS installed. That is a mandatory mod to have installed for Cacteye to work (as indicated in the OP).

Can't say if that is the root of your problem, but you may try. And yes, confirm what you and JeffreyCor said, Cacteye is a great mod!

EDIT: please note that with the latest release 0.3 of HullCamVDS, you must also update the Cacteye plugin to the version AlbertVDS posted a few days ago.

Edited June 10, 2014 by diomedea

This mod deletes EVERY SINGLE PART, stock or mod. Along with every active ship or debris.

Sounds like one of the mods you use has one opening or closing curly bracket too many or too few.

Make a backup of your saved game and systematically move mods out of Gamedata to find out which mod is the culprit.

Try to move halve of the total folders to work through the mods faster.
